comments:
build 2002-10-18, Win2k, J9.

I downloaded the new build and ran it against my old workspace and the JRE_LIB 
classpath variable was not present anymore. Here are the entries from the .log 
file.

!SESSION Oct 19, 2002 18:31:15.672 ---------------------------------------------
java.version=1.3.0 subset
java.vendor=IBM Corporation
BootLoader constants: OS=win32, ARCH=x86, WS=win32, NL=en_US
Command-line arguments: -os win32 -ws win32 -arch x86 -data 
\eclipse\target\head\plugins\ -install file:D:/eclipse/dev/i1018/eclipse/
!ENTRY org.eclipse.jdt.launching 4 4 Oct 19, 2002 18:31:15.712
!MESSAGE VM type element with unknown id
!ENTRY org.eclipse.jdt.ui 4 1 Oct 19, 2002 18:46:19.812
!MESSAGE VariableBlock: Classpath variable with null value: JRE_LIB
!ENTRY org.eclipse.jdt.ui 4 1 Oct 19, 2002 18:46:19.902
!MESSAGE VariableBlock: Classpath variable with null value: JRE_SRCROOT
!ENTRY org.eclipse.jdt.ui 4 1 Oct 19, 2002 18:46:19.922
!MESSAGE VariableBlock: Classpath variable with null value: JRE_SRC

I saw this happen once - but could not figure out what went wrong. I eventually 
threw away my workspace and started again. It has no happenned since (about a 
month ago). Hmmm.

This is weird because I created the variable manually and then (eventually) 
shutdown Eclipse. When I went back in...it was removed again!

(got the same info in the .log on startup)

This happenned to me again, and I noticed this in my log:
